results.title: Mr. & Mrs. Edgehill (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gavin Millar, Alan Shallcross, Arts and Entertainment Network, Quintet Films and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Star Quality : The Stories of Noel Coward”.
Lady Cynthia is a woman of wealth and position, but she is touched and amazed at the love and devotion Mr. and Mrs. Edgehill feel for one another. What is it that makes this ordinary couple so content with their life - even on a remote and desolate South Sea island. Starring Judi Dench and Ian Holm and adapted from a story by Noel Coward.

results.title: Star Quality (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Alan Dosser, Alan Shallcross, Quintet Films and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Star Quality : The Stories of Noel Coward”.
At first a young writer, whose new play is being staged, thinks that the production will be plain sailing, but soon he’s convinced that he and his play are doomed when the star quality of the leading lady and the director come into conflict. Screenplay by Stanley Price, based on the original by Noel Coward. Starring Susannah York, Ian Richardson and David Yellan.

results.title: The World of David the Gnome
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description: A series of videos each containing two adventures of David the Gnome, his wife Lisa and faithful fox, Swift, narrated by Christopher Plummer and animated for the screen from the stories of Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen.

results.title: Good medicine; witch way out (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David the gnome enters the wonderful world of adventure as he tries to help his fellow creatures out of trouble. This program consists of 2 episodes, ‘Good Medicine’ captures David’s skills as a doctor and ‘Witch Way Out?’ finds David and his faithful fox, Swift, captured by ugly and vicious trolls. Based on the book “The Gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Will Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Little houses for little people
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, BRB International, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David tells us more about the magical world of the gnomes. In “Little houses for little people” he explains the gnomes’ secret and special underground houses. “The wedding that almost wasn’t” - All the Gnomes gather to celebrate a wedding - but the trolls are unwelcome guests! Based on “The gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Good medicine; witch way out
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, BRB International, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
Join David, his wife Lisa and faithful fox, Swift, for two wonderful adventures in the secret and magical world of the gnomes. “Good medicine” tells how David’s skill as a doctor is needed to help a sick animal. In ‘Witch way out” David and Swift are captured by the ugly and vicious trolls. Based on “The gnomes’ by Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: A Day in the Life of a Woman
results.brief_description: A series narrated by Judy Morris and introduced by Franca Arena, depicting the diversity in the lives of seven individual women of the Asian and Australian region. Each episode is devoted to exploring their roles in the home, at work and within their own cultures.
results.title_for_label: A Day in the Life of a Woman

results.title: An immigrant woman
results.creator_credit: Ian Lap Man, Gian Manara, TDM Macau, SBS-TV and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Wong King Chan is a Chinese immigrant living and working in extremely hard conditions in Macau. Her factory work takes her away from her husband and two children for at least ten hours a day, then she returns to the tiny one room flat in a tenement building they share with three others. As we follow her daily routine we learn of her hopes to save enough money to buy a flat which will generate enough income to provide for her children’s education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Lap Man, Gian Manara, TDM Macau, SBS-TV and Asian Broadcasting Union

results.title: A Woman of Sri Lanka
results.creator_credit: Sisira Suraweera, Gian Manara, SLRC Sri Lanka, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Udayani is a young Sri Lankan wife and mother who lives in a village near Kandy. She lives a simple traditional life rooted in Buddhist beliefs and customs. She is shown at work in the fields and at home, visiting the Temple of the Tooth in Kandy at the time of an important festival and assisting in the preparations for her younger sister’s marriage. The program is introduced by Franca Arena.

results.title: Johura
results.creator_credit: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, BTV Bangladesh and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Johura lives on an island on a river in Bangladesh with her husband and small children. They are very poor and, to supplement their income, Johura makes an arduous journey every day into Dakkha where she works as a machinist in a textile factory. Her life is hard, yet she strives to educate her own children as well as those of the neighbouring shanties. Franca Arena introduces her story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, BTV Bangladesh and Asian Broadcasting Union
